## EXERCISE 2

```{r hw1-ex2}
edibnb %>%
  filter(
    neighbourhood == "Old Town",
    price >= 100
    )%>%
  count()

properties_four <- edibnb %>%
  filter(
    neighbourhood == "Southside",
    accommodates >= 4
  )
properties_four %>%
  summarise(
    mean_price = mean(price),
    minimum_price = min(price),
    maximum_price = max(price)
  )

```


There has 552 number of Airbnb properties located in Old Town having the one night stay price larger than 100 GBP.
For Airbnb properties in Southside for a single night stay for four people, the minimum price is 10, maximum price is 800, and average price is 153.1368.

## EXERCISE 3

```{r hw1-ex3}
edibnb %>%
  filter(neighbourhood == "Newington")%>%
  count(bathrooms)

bathrooms_edibnb <- edibnb %>%
  mutate(
    bathrooms = case_when(
      bathrooms == 0.5 ~ 1,
      bathrooms == 1.5 ~ 2,
      bathrooms == 2.5 ~ 3,
      bathrooms == 3.5 ~ 4
      )
    )

bathrooms_edibnb %>%
  filter(bathrooms >= bedrooms)%>%
  count()


```
